intro: Neolloydia ceratites, commonly known as the horned milkweed, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It is characterized by its distinctive, horn-like structures on its stems and leaves, which give it its common name. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically from late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed or dry habitats. Neolloydia ceratites is a member of the Apocynaceae family, known for its milky sap and medicinal properties in some species.
